entry.title: The Unbreakable Variable
entry.summary:
Author: lam5_5ish

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,268Chapters: 21/21Kudos: 7

Summary: Two boys, isolated in different ways, find solace in each other. Their bond becomes the foundational axis of their lives, shaping their careers and their hearts. But when their worlds officially collide, the depth of their connection becomes a source of awe, confusion, and jealousy for the two men who secretly love them.

entry.title: It's a weird life, but it's where i'm at right now…
entry.summary:
Author: salenora

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,024Chapters: 8/30Kudos: 166

Summary: Buck goes back to the 118 after the lawsuit. The team forgives him and work feels normal again. But outside the firehouse, no one invites him out. Buck feels lonely. One night he finds a new bar called the Griffin. There, he meets some new friends. Buck also learns he is going to be a dad. Or,Buck and Jess sleep together - and Jess gets pregnant. entry.title: The Price of Power
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 87,762Chapters: 14/?Kudos: 11

Summary: Athena Carter and Bobby Nash couldn’t be more different. She’s the disciplined “good girl” with her future mapped out, while he’s the dangerous bad boy with one foot in college and the other in the streets. When their worlds start to collide, what begins as a bitter rivalry quickly sparks into something deeper neither of them can ignore. But falling for Bobby means stepping into a world Athena never imagined, one ruled by loyalty and violence. That tested everything she thought she knew about herself. As sparks turn to fire, Athena must decide if love is worth the risk of losing everything.

entry.title: Evergrowing
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 86,980Chapters: 15/?Kudos: 12

Summary: Athena and Bobby are learning that parenting doesn’t end when the kids turn eighteen. With three grown children and two still at home, Bobby and Athena find themselves navigating new challenges at every stage of life. Each child carries their own struggles, some spoken and some hidden, but together the family works through the ups and downs with love, patience, and resilience. At the heart of it all, they’re reminded that family is a bond that grows, shifts, and deepens, no matter how old the kids get.

entry.title: Second Chances
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 102,040Chapters: 15/?Kudos: 29

Summary: Bobby and Athena are just two people trying to put their lives back together while figuring out how to co-parent. What starts as a complicated plan to foster kids in need slowly turns into something much deeper. Through the ups and downs of heartbreak, healing, and raising children who’ve been through so much, they find strength in each other. Over time, their partnership grows into love, and together, they build a story about family, trust, and second chances.

entry.summary:
Author: Iceprincess96

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,673Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 0

Summary: When Eddie Diaz joins the 118, Buck is unsettled by the newcomer’s calm confidence and quiet capability. What starts as irritation quickly spirals into hostility, until one thoughtless remark cuts deeper than Buck ever intended. Eddie retreats behind walls he swore he’d left behind, and Buck is left facing the damage he’s done—and the silence that follows.

entry.title: The Cradle of Ruins; An Undoing of the Years
entry.summary:
Author: marry_rites

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 29,602Chapters: 3/3Kudos: 0

Summary: Her hand circled around Eddie's gloved wrist as she nodded to herself, eyeing something the human eye was incapable of seeing. Something Eddie would never believe in or so he thought a week ago.“He, who is most cherished by you will be snatched away, for you do not believe in the very destiny that has brought you to him and him to you. Snatched away, ripped away from you and with destiny furious at you for never believing in it nor in the miracle of it bringing him back to you from the depths of the unspoken place and the edge of the unreachable realm time and time again, you'll be on your own, boy. When your North star leaves your sky, that's when you'll look for the belief that has kept you two inseparable till now.” “Buck?” The confusion in his voice was reflected in the boy’s terrified eyes as he looked at Eddie with fear, fear that had never been present in those blue eyes, not in the grown version of them, never when they were looking at Eddie. “Eddie. You can call me Eddie.”OR when a friendly witch warns you about your bad karma, you might want to stop and listen instead of insulting her...

entry.title: Viral Valor: Five Alarms and a Lifeline
entry.summary:
Author: Glovvfish

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,112Chapters: 2/2Kudos: 239

Summary: Eddie Diaz never asked to become the internet’s favorite firefighter. It starts with a car crash, a starstruck teenager, and a poorly timed selfie. Suddenly, “LAFD Updates Man” is trending, and Eddie’s face is everywhere—from rescues gone memetic to a cat-related TikTok sensation.Between dodging photo requests mid-emergency and enduring the 118’s relentless teasing, Eddie’s ready to quit social media for good. But when a viral moment collides with a life-or-death crisis, he’s forced to confront the chaos—and the unexpected ways his online persona has touched lives. With Buck by his side, Eddie learns that even accidental fame can spark hope.

entry.title: you live, you die, you live again
entry.summary:
Author: andtimestoodstill

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 42,219Chapters: 2/3Kudos: 201

Summary: Shannon Diaz née Garrett had a high tolerance for bullshit. You don’t get married at eighteen, become a mom at nineteen, and survive living under the omnipresent gaze of the world’s most… particular in-laws without developing many, many strategies for self-preservation. Every snide remark about Chris’ CP, every passive aggressive comment from Helena Diaz, every vertebra of Eddie’s liquid spine, Shannon took right on the chin with a smile on her face. But there was no corner of Shannon’s life that she tested her extreme tolerance for bullshit more than whatever the Samwise-and-Frodo, Bert-and-Ernie, Crockett-and-Tubbs hell was going on between her ex-husband and his best friend. (In which Shannon Diaz née Garrett lives, gets divorced, and helps her ex-husband realize that he’s in love with his best friend)

entry.title: my future seems like one big past
entry.summary:
Author: MissyAndTheDocs

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,206Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 6

Summary: “Do you regret it?”Lena shakes her head, more hair coming lose from her bun. “I know the wise thing would be to say I do. I’m reformed, I’ve seen the error of my ways. But I don’t. Fighting got me through tough times, fighting was there for me when I wasn’t ready to heal, when I needed an outlet for all the pain and the rage but couldn’t handle facing it. I’m where I am now because of it.”Buck nods along but he can’t say he’s listening. Not anymore, the words “outlet” and “rage” dancing a vicious tango at the forefront of his consciousness. But he knows enough to nod along and Lena must read something on his face, must notice that he’s gone again, because she swiftly makes her way to the parking lot, goodbyes said but no words registering in Buck’s brain. He’s still nodding, but more so to himself this time.~~~~OR: Buck does not know how to deal with Bobby's death and all the feelings from it. A surprise guest at the funeral gives him a solution but it's not something Buck's allowed to pursue, not if Eddie Diaz has anything to say about it.

entry.title: Death called to the wolf
entry.summary:
Author: shadowkatninjawarrior

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 146,743Chapters: 64/?Kudos: 1,282

Summary: Evan Buckley was intimately familiar with death. It hung in the air around him, lived under his skin.It was the reason he'd been born in the first place.Maybe it had seemed like some awful cosmic joke to his parents when they'd found out the source of his magic. It could have been anything.It just had to be death.Eddie Diaz doesn't know how to be a werewolf.Which is unfortunate, given he's been one all his life. He brought his son to LA to get away from it all, but he couldn't run from what he was.Or:Death Mage Buck and Werewolf Eddie find one another at the 118.

entry.title: Happier Than Ever
entry.summary:
Author: stonyismyotp

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 14,350Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 91

Summary: "It’s Dr. Wells. The Dr. Wells Bobby had sent Buck to, over a year and a half ago. The same one he couldn’t quite admit had taken advantage of him, had made him feel numb whenever he tried sharing his feelings, who made it impossible to open up to any other therapist— She was there and she had a baby. A baby who couldn’t be more than ten months old. A baby with his blonde hair and bright blue eyes, not her dark hair and dark eyes." or Dr. Wells had a baby & never told Buck. - title from the song by billie eilish pls heed the tags, & i'll be putting warnings at the beginning of each chapter, this is going to be a relatively heavy fic (tho it will be focused on recovery) so pls prioritize your own mental health.

entry.title: stay alive, open wide
entry.summary:
Author: dogfishmonger

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 302,705Chapters: 30/40Kudos: 823

Summary: He feels like shit when he's hungry, and he plays better when he's empty. The cold air doesn't touch him as much. The floodlights turn silvery-soft.And he likes eating. Keeps his hands busy, mouth busy, mind busy. Something to chew through, putty in the ears.Go until he can't anymore. Cycle it back out. Be ready. --OR: Buck's had on-again, off-again bulimia since he was 14.--Updates on Wednesdays. Title from Psychic Friend's "We Do Not Belong".

entry.title: The man I buried, the man I found.
entry.summary:
Author: Noasshowaddiction

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 46,125Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 104

Summary: Evan Buckley buried the love of his life years ago. Eddie Diaz’s death was the wound Buck never recovered from—the folded flag, the funeral, the medals pressed into his hands were all he had left.Except Eddie isn’t dead.When Eddie walks into the 118 as their newest firefighter, Buck’s world comes crashing down all over again. Grief collides with longing, fury with love, and suddenly Buck is forced to face the man he mourned, the man who promised he’d come back, and the man who let him believe he never would.Working side by side should be impossible. Pretending they’re just coworkers is unbearable. And when secrets, old promises, and new dangers come to light, Buck has to decide whether the man he buried is the same one he’s found—or if some ghosts can never be forgiven.
